title: Talent Acquisition Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: Introductions One Questions from Each Interviewer Opportunity to Ask Questions 20 Minutes Everyone was extremely nice and pleasant to have a conversation with. It did not feel like a firing range of questions, and I was able to leave the interview feeling confident.
Interview Questions: Have you ever mentored anyone?

title: Working Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Held over Zoom, 20 minutes. Found out next day if moved to next level. It was with 5 people. A lot of questions. It was very friendly and they explained it well and it went smoothly.
Interview Questions: What makes me the best candidate

title: Fundraising Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: thirty minute phone call for first interview with a group of about 5 people. then half day campus interview with multiple departments at multiple locations. It included folks that the person would be working with. Even provided a campus tour.
Interview Questions: Why UCCS? Why this role? How do you value DEI?

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with a panel of several people, they promised a prompt follow up, then they ghosted next. Seems they don’t reciprocate the respect candidates show them. An email back would be appreciated.
Interview Questions: What are the top 3 most important characteristics of a fundraiser.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs
Interview Descriptions:
1 ) 30 min interview with the adviser. During the interview, the adviser asked me to take about my approach when I face new problems. 

2) 60 min coding interview with post-doc and Ph.D. students
Interview Questions: what is the self in defining python class?

title: Artist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Online interview with the editors. They ask you pretty easy questions and they are very understanding and take what you say into account. They were very friendly and made the interview process a lot more comfortable. And they get back to you fairly quickly as well.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the Scribe

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs
Interview Descriptions: Not even a full day. Barely met any faculty. Met with Chair, Dean, and Search Committee. All seemed nice. Dinner with a few faculty. They talked among themselves and not as much to me. Seemed like they knew each other well. That was a positive sign.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions. Nothing challenging. I do not think that they are good at interviewing.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs
Interview Descriptions: It was not as formal as some others I have been on and seemed a little less professional. What was promised upon my hiring was not followed through once I became an employee.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself.

title: Student Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and recieved a phone call a few weeks later inviting me for a phone interview.  The questions were straightforward, and what you would expect from said department.  The first phone call was with a panel of 4 or 5 people and they went through the questions somewhat quickly.  On the second round of interviews, I was expecting a longer, more in depth interview but it was very short and superficial,  considering they had already screened applicants duting the first round.  After a month, there has been no follow up Or update regarding the application status.
Interview Questions: What does diversity mean to you?

title: Budget Anal Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs
Interview Descriptions: The interview processs started with an in-person interview with a four-person panel followed by a second, final final interview with two supervisors. Standard interview questions were asked and the atmosphere was comfortable.
Interview Questions: What would people who work with you say is your greatest weakness?

title: Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was one in person interview, it was basic questions like what if situations. They also asked if you had any basic cooking skills and if you're willing to learn some
Interview Questions: Do you have any knife skills

title: Housing Occupancy Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was an all-day interview with several different departments. They gave you lunch and it was an overall great experience. The staff was very kind and supportive and it is an enviornment I realy enjoyed.
Interview Questions: WhatI thought I could bring to the team?

title: HR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was a first interview for a position. It was a telephone interview with a panel of other employees. Each person introduced themselves and then each person asked a question. There was a 20 min limit for the interview.
Interview Questions: What is your take on diversity?

title: Degree Audit Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The was first interaction was to set up a phone interview, Skype, with a group of about 6. Then a one-on-on with the Director a few weeks later for the 3 finalists.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest fear about this job?

title: Orientation Welcoming Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process was great process. I was asked a bunch of questions based on leadership. I easily answered them with ease. After the interview, I had waited after a week to get a call back. I got the job and it was very smooth and fast process.
Interview Questions: What would you do in a situation where a student wasn't feeling included in an activity?

title: Event Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs
Interview Descriptions: Apply online as a UCCS student (MUST BE STUDENT) short 25-30min interview at school. Their is not much else to say. It is fairly easy to get this job.
Interview Questions: What does professional work look like to you?

title: Barista Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easiest interview of your life. They called me for an interview the day after I submitted the application. They asked very straightforward, first level questions. It was casual and conversational. The interview only took 15 minutes maximum.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Teacher and Lab Assistant and Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It depends on the specific teacher. They require to have passed their course or have similar qualification. Other than that there is no such thing as a formal interview, the students should talk either with teachers or department chairs in order to match the job openings with your capabilities
Interview Questions: Do you have experience programming and debugging in C

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview, which went the same as interviews go. However, there was also a test for mathematics abilities. This involved topics from college algebra all the way until calculus 3. It was required that the tutor have the minimum of calculus 3 in math skills. Other than that, the interview was not unusual in any manner. The director and the assistant director were both present for the interview.
Interview Questions: They handed me a test for math and some books.

title: Cashier/Barista Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: They try to keep it as straight forward as possible. And might ask you what kind of food would you describe yourself as at the end. No right or wrong answer, it's just out of fun.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this job?

title: Public Safety Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs
Interview Descriptions: Simple Panel interview, basic questions, went over my resume and my best experience, talked about my hobbies and their hobbies, got a tour of the facilites and talk more about the position. Overall it was simple
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you have to complete multiple tasks ?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Process took about a week from application to job offer. Very standard questions were asked during the interview. Things like strengths and weaknesses, etc. They gave a detailed description of the job scope. They also wanted to know my class schedule- very strict about work hours not overlapping with class schedule. Definitely wasn't an informal interview. Formal, but relaxed. Overall, it was a pretty easy interview. I got a call a few hours after the interview and they offered me the job.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where you have many tasks to complete in a short period of time?

title: Student Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straight forward. Asked basic question that one might expect during an interview. Was hired on the spot. Employee gave a little background information about herself and the department. Then asked for background information from applicant. Didn't ask if applicant knew any specifics of the department, just if they could perform the duties.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this department?

title: Cook II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was called in after 3 months to talk with the Executive Chef. He was very inattentive. He kept checking his phone and leaving the room. He turned a 20 min. interview into a 45 min. one. Basically I was brought into a conference room and asked very standard questions.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths? What are your weaknesses?

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was a student of the professor and he knew I needed money. He spoke to me and asked if I would be able to grade for him for a class. This was an informal process with no room for salary negotiation. It was a part time temporary grader position.
Interview Questions: Do you want to grade for me for class xxx?

title: Web Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Laid back.  Reviewed skills, asked basic questions, mostly about usability and technologies.
Interview Questions: Favorite website designs....unexpected for a programming job.

title: Lab Assistant At Vast Lab Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Just my resume was sent and I was selected. My Professor just reviewed my course details and my GPA and this was it. I was not asked any more questions in regard to that. The work I did there was from scratch learnt and did.
Interview Questions: Nothing much, just reviwed my resume and I was selected

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview to see if they want to call you in for a face-to-face interview. Easy questions of past experiences/workplaces that are similar to the position applying for.  Best to use group work in answering majority of their questions. Have confidence in yourself with being humble will earn your points in the interview process.
Interview Questions: Describe a past time when you faced conflict in your workplace and how did you handle it?

title: Human Resources Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: You will meet with the Search Committee, with a possible follow-on interview with the supervisor, typically the Business Affairs Manager, and another interview with the Dean.
Interview Questions: The interviewing process was easy.  The Search Committee seemed more intent on evaluating my personality than my qualifications.

title: Institutional Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Colorado Springs (Colorado Springs, CO) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: The posting and application process is entirely online. The interview was straightforward and occurred about 3 weeks after the position announcement closed and was conducted by phone.  I was interviewed by a team of three people, then had a 1:1 interview with the hiring dean.  It is my understanding that, though the process is standard as per state requirements, working around campus is different in each college/department.  There is a fair amount of autonomy for the deans of each college, and he/she can structure the job as needed.
Interview Questions: The campus has a strong commitment to diversity, so be prepared to discuss your experiences with working with diverse groups of people and how you expect to honor that commitment within the position you are seeking.
